Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.internal

Class ThreadHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.internal.ThreadHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    P_SweetHandler
    public class ThreadHandler
extends Object
implements P_SweetHandler
    Class used by the library to post Runnables. You shouldn't ever need to subclass this, as it's all implemented for you. However, if you want SweetBlue to run it's update logic on an already created Thread in your app (rather than creating a new Thread), then you will need to use this class. You must make sure to call loop() within the existing Thread's runnable, otherwise the class won't execute it's commands.

      If you are running SweetBlue's update logic in your own thread, you must remember to call this method inside of the Runnable for the your Thread.

      Post a Runnable to be executed by the Thread backing this handler.

    • Field Detail

      • m_running

        protected final AtomicBoolean m_running

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadHandler

        public ThreadHandler()
        Create a new instance of ThreadHandler. If you are using this class to run SweetBlue's update logic in a thread you already have in your app, you must remember to call loop() in it's Runnable. This is setup as an update loop, so if your Thread's runnable doesn't loop, this class won't help much.

    • Method Detail

      • loop

        public final void loop()
        If you are running SweetBlue's update logic in your own thread, you must remember to call this method inside of the Runnable for the your Thread.
